item.title: Asst. Professor S. Y. Yeo (Team Lead)
item.description: S. Y. Yeo is currently an Asst. Professor at NTU. His research focuses on the development and use of AI and computer vision technologies for biomedical data analysis and interpretation.

item.title: Asst. Professor Liu Jun (Visiting Faculty)
item.description: Liu Jun is currently an Asst. Professor at SUTD. His research focuses on computer vision, video analytics and medical imaging.

item.title: Analysis of Medical Imaging Data
item.description: There are several projects on medical imaging data, including segmentation, alignment, feature detection and classification.

item.title: Computer Vision and Video Analytics for Medical Tasks
item.description: Computer vision has several uses in the medical domain. In MVAIT, researchers develop computer vision technologies and methods which can facilitate medical tasks.

item.title: Multimodal Data Analysis and Interpretation
item.description: Construction of web going on … Multimodal Data Multimodal Data Analysis Multimodal Data Interpretation

item.title: Population Health
item.description: The research on population health is important for the advancement of medical technologies for the society.

item.title: NLP for Healthcare
item.description: Language Models MVAIT is interested in the use of language models for medical tasks.

item.title: Specific Medical Domain
item.description: MVAIT has strong collaboration with clinicians from different medical domains.

item.title: About
item.description: MVAIT develops AI models that can enhance the healthcare industry and to introduce efficient medical technologies to the society.

item.description: Email: mvisailab@gmail.com

item.title: Positions
item.description: Thank you for being so interested in MVAIT. MVAIT welcomes excellent and motivated students, postdocs, software engineers and visiting researchers who are interested in developing software and AI technologies for medicine.
